intro: Oenanthe kudoi, commonly known as the Japanese cowbane, is a flowering plant native to parts of East Asia, including Japan, Korea, and China. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks. Its flowers are small and white, arranged in umbels, and it produces a distinctive, milky sap. Oenanthe kudoi is known for its toxic properties, containing compounds that can be harmful to humans and animals.
